full_text: Today I spoke with Geraldine Finucane & her family in the context of the Govts ongoing support for an independent public inquiry into the murder of Pat Finucane  – upcoming UK Govt response to UKSC decision makes this a very NB time in their long, dignified & determined campaign.
Congratulations to Comdt Luke Foley - I look forward to working with you in the interests the @defenceforces https://t.co/CDEev6nhmF

Once again we stand with #France & french people in the face of violence & terrorism. Nous présentons nos condoléances et notre solidarité avec la France après une nouvelle attaque terroriste. Tous les français sont dans nos pensées et nos prières aujourd'hui. https://t.co/cRiUD4vATZ

Powerful display of democracy in Chile yesterday. Chile is an important partner of Ireland & EU in Latin America & we look forward to sharing our experiences, including on constitutional reform, as critical work of writing a new constitution begins. #Plebiscito2020 @IrlEmbChile
@ciarancannon Well done Ciaran.... what a fantastic effort!

Tomorrow @MichelBarnier and @DavidGHFrost will meet in London on #Brexit which is very welcome. The stakes are high & nothing is guaranteed but a trade deal to minimise the damage of Brexit is possible. 🇪🇺🇬🇧 https://t.co/wyZ4vIN3qu
Brilliant work by @RNLI - fantastic seamanship, preventing an environmental disaster. Thanks guys! @DunmoreEastRNLI @KilmoreQuayRNLI @RosslareRNLI https://t.co/85IPrgvxKD

Very tough day for businesses in #Cork city. Govt tonight opened an Emergency Humanitarian Aid Scheme for businesses affected by flooding. Up to €20,000 is available for damage, stock & repairs. Outline of scheme below. @corkcitycouncil @CBA_cork #CorkFloods https://t.co/XQqHndP6V8

Gutting scenes from #Cork city centre this morning. Trading conditions are tough enough without this ontop of everything else! We will make sure Govt supports are available to the businesses impacted by flooding  as soon as possible. https://t.co/lhAkyOw5Ps

@Eoinmpos @CBA_cork @Nash19Cork @montycork @michaelodono99 @mmag1975 @DaveOBrien I know Govt decisions tonight are a huge blow for many businesses for the next 6 weeks. We will do everything we can to support you through these restrictions. For now we are acting to save lives, reduce #Covid spread & plan for a better December & Christmas.

Govt made necessary decisions tonight to protect people from #COVID19, but I know how difficult the consequences are for so many for the next 6 wks. That’s why we’ve increased financial supports & protections. Please work with us & together we can beat this virus! https://t.co/tMTSXfxBbA
Bienvenue en Irlande @vincentguerend 🇫🇷🇮🇪🇪🇺 https://t.co/l4Bg7I4kP9

@BBCPolitics EU’s been consistent throughout #Brexit, working for a deal. LPF & Fisheries were always going to be difficult issues to resolve.  It’s UK that’s moved away from commitments made a year ago & now has unrealistic demands. Let’s get back to negotiation & focus on getting deal done!
@gerard_guinan @pdforra @IRLDeptDefence @naval_service Look forward to working with you to implement this and other initiatives - c u Tuesday.
@RACO_DF @defenceforces @naval_service @IrishAirCorps @2BdeGoc @goc_dftc @DF_COS Onwards and upwards @defenceforces
We are setting up a dedicated Climate Unit in @dfatirl @Irish_Aid https://t.co/01OcCVosxI

1st time in 22 yrs I missed  Budget. I was with @MichelBarnier focusing on #Brexit & protecting #Ireland as we reach endgame. Budget sets aside enormous funding to protect livelihoods through a No-Trade-Deal Brexit, but we are still working for a deal. It can be achieved! 🇪🇺🇬🇧

Another focused & positive meeting with @MichelBarnier in #Luxembourg on #Brexit & finding a way to get agreement with #UK. Message on fishing is clear: Fishermen matter to the EU & will remain a priority in negotiations! https://t.co/1C1CxuZV3F
Had a very good meeting with @MarosSefcovic today - we are continuing to work to ensure the full implementation of the Withdrawal Agreement & NI/IRE Protocol. #Brexit https://t.co/CivmpmPhc0
Good stuff @corkcitycouncil #corkcc https://t.co/dMWynzfvQT
@Paschald @annatters @mmcgrathtd We’re fortunate to have 2 safe pairs of hands, working together for #Ireland at a crucial time.

Good, constructive meeting with SOSNI @BrandonLewis today. We focused on need for increased cooperation on #Covid as numbers rise dramatically.  We also had frank exchange on #Brexit & progressing NI protocol.  Agreed to work towards full implementation of #NewDecadeNewApproach https://t.co/7ypp7IzE1P
@neasa_neasa You should be very proud of her.

A lot of fear, anger & worry today on #Covid & right response for the country. We must not allow it turn to division. This is a pandemic, normal rules don’t apply. Let’s stick together. Govt will make decisions in best interests of public health, taking all advice into account.

@SteveAikenUUP @BobbyMcDonagh1 Steve, when Unionist concerns aren’t mentioned in Irish media you’re unhappy, when balanced people like Bobby try to recognise unionist concerns you’re unhappy. Perhaps less twitter criticism & more talking might help. I’m happy to talk at any point as I have been through Brexit.
@PJohnstonFCDO @dfatirl @PresidentIRL @BritEmbDublin @FCDOGovUK Looking forward to working with you. Welcome to #Ireland.
Congratulations @RockiesCork - fantastic win #RockiesAbu . https://t.co/QbKhI3X2Uq
@Doddser74 @SophiaGrene Yes. Despite a negative test, I am required to restrict my movement to essential work only. I’ll be tested again in 7 days. Working from home today, like so many others....

@SophiaGrene I took a Covid test on returning to Ireland yesterday, as is required under the protocol for Ministerial international travel.  I got confirmation of a negative result this morning. So all clear thankfully. Thanks for your concern.
The right decision. https://t.co/g0XFdoIwzQ

Thanks @HeikoMaas - strong #EU solidarity as ever on #Brexit. A new UK/EU Future Relationship & Trade Deal is achievable, but existing legal commitments must be honoured too. 🇪🇺🇮🇪🇬🇧 https://t.co/U4EQsHLSle

Successful visit to Washington! Pictures say it all - warm welcome, relationship stronger than ever, support for #Ireland position on #Brexit very clear. Protecting stability & peace on Island of Ireland by full implementation of NI/Ire Protocol is being closely followed. 🇺🇸🇮🇪 https://t.co/z6Ym8il7rn
Great appointment! @nealerichmond https://t.co/SEIDpHuf0M
@OxfordDiplomat Take care of yourself. Your energy and positivity inspires others!

I would like to extend Ireland’s deepest sympathies and sincere condolences to all those affected by the tragic air accident near Kharkiv. We stand in solidarity with Ukraine at this very sad and difficult time. @DmytroKuleba @MFA_Ukraine

It was my pleasure to welcome US Special Envoy on Northern Ireland @JMMulvaney1 to Iveagh House to discuss #Brexit & the peace process. Later, I’ll travel to Washington DC for meetings with political leaders to highlight the unbreakable bond between Ireland & USA. 🇮🇪🇺🇸 https://t.co/R80aQWLsvH
